One of the best movies ever made. I'm so glad I got to watch this masterpiece from Ron Howard who presents this legendary rivalry between two of the greatest drivers in F1 history Nikki Lauda and James Hunt to absolute perfection and Hans Zimmer's score (particularly one from the climax) makes it so much more beautiful. It is a compelling and engaging story of two fierce rivals who can't stand watching the other win yet share a mutual admiration towards one another. Needless to say, it is one of the finest movies I've ever watched.

I loved this movie. Being a lover of cars, motorsports, and F1 this movie was a natural choice for me. They picked the perfect cast to represent the characters. Seeing the dynamics of an extravert and an introvert being rivals in the sport was fascinating because their different perspectives and values and reasons for desiring the championship. What a contrast the two character brought to the film. The film showcases some well known race tracks ie Monza, Nürburgring, Fuji Raceway and the racing scenes were well done.

I love this movie.. 9/10!

Im glad I was able to see a film adaptation of the rivalry between James Hunt and Nikki Lauda as its one of the best sports rivalries ever existed. It shows that they just didnt want to beat eachother and saw eachother as enemies but it shows how they looked out for eachother and showed respect between them. 

I feel Chris Hemsworth and Daniel Bruhl did excellent job at recreating these motorsport heros.

This movie is a masterpiece. It surprises me that the movie hasn't got the recognition it deserves, but this is a fantastic movie with an outstanding background score from Hans Zimmer. Perfect adaptation of rivalry and how the rivals respect each other on and off the field. Glad to have seen and experienced this movie numerous times and the song 'Lost but won' will remain my all time favorite.

One of the best movies I have seen. Breathtaking cinematography and heart pumping background score which depicts rivalry, emotions, and what not. Daniel Bruhl and Chris Hemsworth lived their roles. And not to forget Peter Morgan's fantastic script writing skills and Ron Howard's direction. Watch it. I strongly recommend it because it has got everything a watcher wants to see in a movie.
